name: Bourbon Cataratas Convention & Spa Resort

reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights.
reviews.title: It's being renovated, good for them

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is clean but a little run down. On the good side it is being renovated.
reviews.title: Relaxing hotel with outdoor pool

reviews.text: At night the walls that divide the room are extremely thin and I had loud brazilian women in the room next to me. I called the desk twice and there was very little help. I barely got any sleep and it totally affected my performance at work the next day.
reviews.title: Great location, needs updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel has an outdoor pool with sunbeds, also a garden walk through tropical vegetation including bananas growing. There were also emus, toucans etc in enclosures. There are restaurants in the hotel and the food was good. Breakfast is very busy with everyone getting up early to go out for the day.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel--off season and during the week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated away from any nearby town, so nowhere to go at night, but as we were on a 2-day trip to Iguassu Falls, this did not really matter to us as the day time was the main event.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but really a hotel for families.

reviews.text: Fantastic facilities. Kids entertainmentis guaranteed. Big rooms, very nice and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I traveled with my wife and 2 kids (8 and 4 y.o.) and I can say we have relaxed a lot. The hotel is located close to waterfalls, Birds Park (beatiful) and border with Argentina (tip: we bought a lot of great wines and we ate fantastic meats there for low prices).
reviews.title: A Mellow Hotel in a Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Foz do Iguacu is one of the true natural wonders of the modern world. It makes Niagara Falls look like a kitchen faucet. This hotel is a short drive from the Falls and it makes a nice place to hang out for a few days while you are visiting the Falls. The grounds are very nice and the swimming pool is a fun place to have a few drinks and enjoy the warm weather. The buffet dinner in the evening is one of the best I had in Brazil so save some room. The rooms are nice, clean and air conditioned.
reviews.title: Good spot for exploring the waterfalls

reviews.text: This is a nice, large hotel just over the border between Argentina and Brazil. We booked through a travel agent, so we got a lower price; however, I would definitely not pay the $350-$450 advertised price. The walls of the rooms are very thin--so thin, I thought the man sneezing in the bathroom next to my room was actually in my bathroom.
reviews.title: Paradise in the forest

reviews.text: There is a nice heated pool with a waterfall and a nice sauna in the spa. The downside was that the spa closed at 18:00.
reviews.title: Very elegant, great location

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. It is average at best for the price. The rooms need to be updated, as well as the bathrooms. They are clean though. On the night we stayed, one of the restaurants was closed so the only option we had was a buffet that 56 reais a person, and it didn't look very good. The front desk staff didn't seem to know much about the restaurants in the area, there wasn't really a concierge or anything. I didn't have any problems with service or anything with the hotel but I just think for how much we paid it was not worth it.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: On our last of three stops in Brazil (Salvador and Rio first), this was the nicest hotel in which we stayed with 10 of our original 30 tour group. Bathrooms are modern but room furniture could use updating as the decor is formal. Although we called for help on the first night, our air conditioning never worked until the next day. There was a storm that night, so I don't know if the air was affected. A ceiling fan would be nice. Of course, there are never wash clothes in the bathrooms, although there is a bidet and lots of slippery marble on the floor. The restaurant is very nice. There was lovely music over dinner our first night. The buffet had superb dinner and breakfast selections. Didn't use other facilities as we were there to see Iguazu Falls in Argentina and Brazil. It is conveniently located to the city and the Falls and local restaurants will send transportation for dinner guests. A very nice place to stay and to start our 17 hour journey on three planes back to Atlanta.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with a few blips

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Bourbon for 3 days in October 2011 as part of a Brazil-wide holiday.
reviews.title: Fantastic Iguassu experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel complex was fantastic from the very welcoming reception when checking in until the moment we checked out at 04.30 a.m on the last day!
reviews.title: Not the best, but good enough

reviews.text: The hotel fully deserves its current 5 star (Brazilian) status and I guess had been extensively rennovated in the last 12-18 months or so.
reviews.title: Convenient to the falls

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. The room was comfortable, clean, well appointed and the air conditioning worked well. We spent a fair amount of time in and by the large pool and at the poolside lounge. We did not have children with us but it was obvious that the children's program was great, just by watching the kids and the counsellors at the pool and the surrounding area. Walking around the gardens and paths was very relaxing as was the massage that all three of us had. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. We ate dinner at the Italian restaurant and it was also a buffet but very good, especially the antipasto selections. Service throughout the hotel was friendly and very attentive. On Christmas eve they provided an extensive buffet dinner with entertainment. The room was beautifully decorated and the food was delicious.
reviews.title: I wish I could have stayed a week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very large hotel with a lot of traffic. If you don't mind mingling with the saga groups and screaming kids then this is the hotel for you. The hotel is divided into three parts, the old wing, middle part and high rise modern end. We intially had a room in the old wing which was dreadful but they regard that as a superior room. However, the second room overlooking the pool with a balcony was very acceptable. The breakfast is not bad but it's extremely noisy in the breakfast room. The buffet dinner was good but not cheap and the wine is very expensive. Air con is set at sub-zero levels which contributed towards a cold!
reviews.title: Not good value for money
Sub tropical location, Baltic level Air Con
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bourbon for 3 nights whilst visiting the National Park and Falls. This hotel has just been refurbished and they have done a lovely job, reception and ground floor areas are lovely and the rooms are excellent. The air con was freezing though! we kept turning it down but we always seemed to be too cold, just couldn't get a comfortable temperature, if you turn it off however its way too warm...but hey you don't spend your holiday in your room. The food was lovely, nice buffet breakfast and we ate in the Italian restaurant each night. The bar and pool bar do good snacks too. Staff were very helpful both reception, porters, business centre etc and the room was kept spotless. The Park and the Falls are amazing, its worth taking the time to visit from the Argentinian side as its a totally different experience. Crossing the Argentinian border was a bit tedious, took ages, despite us making an effort to turn up early (8.30am) it was quite quiet when we got there but nothing seemed to be getting through and within 15 mins its was really busy! We waited for a about 45 mins in the end but its worth it as the Falls are a great experience. If you don't mind getting wet go on the Jet boat ...thrilling!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were happy with hotel overall, but the location was another thing; there is nothing to see or visit close by. When we were not in a tour, we had to stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: I liked the hotel but not the location.

reviews.text: A very nicely built resort-hotel, great rooms, great swimming pool area, beautiful garden/forest/plantation, good restaurant (make sure you taste the wine first - their selection seems to be quite random, but they don't mind if you refuse it). Interior design is interesting, with lots of plants and slightly kitschy small statues.
reviews.title: exotic and beautiful, almost kitsch

aka: Bourbon Cataratas Hotel Foz Do Iguacu
